original_title: Probe on suspicious death of SL woman in Kuwait: Geetha
original_body_lines: State Minister of Women and Child Affairs Geetha Kumarasinghe said that the Sri Lankan Ambassador to Kuwait is looking into the suspicious death of a Sri Lankan woman who was employed in Kuwait.
She made these comments during a media briefing where she conversed with the Ambassador via phone to inquire into the matter.
The Minister presented concerns raised by the individual’s family that the woman who was employed overseas for seven years could not have committed suicide.

The Sri Lankan Ambassador briefed the Minister that an investigation into the incident was underway, adding that a comprehensive report has been sent to the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment Manusha Nanayakkara and the Prime Minister.
